issue.message: Class referenced in the manifest, `com.example.test_app.${applicationName}`, was not found in the project or the libraries

On SDK version 23 and up, your app data will be automatically backed up and restored on app install. Consider adding the attribute `android:fullBackupContent` to specify an `@xml` resource which configures which files to backup, or just set `android:fullBackupOnly=true`. More info: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/autobackup
Should explicitly set `android:allowBackup` to `true` or `false` (it's `true` by default, and that can have some security implications for the application's data)
This folder configuration (`v21`) is unnecessary; `minSdkVersion` is 23. Merge all the resources in this folder into `drawable`.
